kin.sdk

Class KinClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • kin.sdk.KinClient

  • public class KinClient
extends java.lang.Object
    An account manager for a KinAccount.

      • KinClient

        public KinClient(@NonNull

        For more details please look at KinClient(Context context,Environment environment,String appId, String storeKey)

      • KinClient

        public KinClient(@NonNull
                 android.content.Context context,
                 @NonNull
                 Environment environment,
                 @NonNull
                 java.lang.String appId,
                 @NonNull
                 java.lang.String storeKey)
        Build KinClient object.
        Parameters:
        context - android context
        environment - the blockchain network details.
        appId - a 4 character string which represent the application id which will be added to each transaction.
        Note: appId must contain only upper and/or lower case letters and/or digits and that the total string length is between 3 to 4. For example 1234 or 2ab3 or bcda, etc.
        storeKey - an optional param which is the key for storing this KinClient data, different keys will store a different accounts.

    • Method Detail

      • addAccount

        @NonNull
public KinAccount addAccount()
                               throws CreateAccountException
        Creates and adds an account.

        Once created, the account information will be stored securely on the device and can be accessed again via the getAccount(int) method.

        Returns:
        KinAccount the account created store the key.
        Throws:
        CreateAccountException

      • importAccount

        @NonNull
public KinAccount importAccount(@NonNull
                                         java.lang.String exportedJson,
                                         @NonNull
                                         java.lang.String passphrase)
                                  throws CryptoException,
                                         CreateAccountException,
                                         CorruptedDataException
        Import an account from a JSON-formatted string.
        Parameters:
        exportedJson - The exported JSON-formatted string.
        passphrase - The passphrase to decrypt the secret key.
        Returns:
        The imported account
        Throws:
        CryptoException
        CreateAccountException
        CorruptedDataException

      • getAccount

        public KinAccount getAccount(int index)
        Returns an account at input index.
        Returns:
        the account at the input index or null if there is no such account

      • getEnvironment

      • getMinimumFee

        public kin.utils.Request<java.lang.Long> getMinimumFee()
        Get the current minimum fee that the network charges per operation. This value is expressed in stroops.
        Returns:
        Request<Integer> - the minimum fee.

      • getMinimumFeeSync

        public long getMinimumFeeSync()
                       throws OperationFailedException
        Get the current minimum fee that the network charges per operation. This value is expressed in stroops.

        Note: This method accesses the network, and should not be called on the android main thread.

        Returns:
        the minimum fee.
        Throws:
        OperationFailedException
